label: assumption-regularity-summary
title: Summary of Regularity Assumptions
nl_summary: This assumption set summarizes the required regularity properties (smoothness, boundedness, positivity) of the domains, potentials, flow field, physical parameters, and algorithmic functions necessary for the rigorous analysis and well-posedness of the coupled mean-field system.

bullet_items.name: H1
bullet_items.text: The domains $X_{	ext{valid}}$ and $V_{	ext{alg}}$ are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.

bullet_items.name: H2
bullet_items.text: The reward potential $R_{	ext{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.

bullet_items.name: H3
bullet_items.text: The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.

bullet_items.name: H4
bullet_items.text: All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.

bullet_items.name: H5
bullet_items.text: The killing rate function $c(z)$ is smooth ($C^\infty$), non-negative, and has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

conditions.text: Boundaries of $X_{	ext{valid}}$ and $V_{	ext{alg}}$ are $C^2$.
Physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.
$c(z)$ has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

parameters.description: A physical parameter (likely related to temperature/scale).

notes.text: These assumptions are stated to be satisfied by the Canonical Euclidean Gas.
The analysis aims to prove existence, uniqueness, and long-term behavior of solutions to the coupled mean-field system.

label: assumption-domain-regularity
title: Regularity of the Valid Domain
nl_summary: The valid position domain $X_{\text{valid}} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ must be an open, bounded domain with a $C^3$ boundary. Additionally, its signed distance function must be $C^2$ near the boundary, which defines the unit inward normal vector.

bullet_items.name: Smoothness
bullet_items.text: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

bullet_items.name: Distance Function
bullet_items.text: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.

bullet_items.name: Unit Inward Normal
bullet_items.text: For each $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$, let $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into $X_{\text{valid}}$).

label: assumption-integrator-regularity
title: Regularity of the Discrete Integrator
nl_summary: This assumption concerns the form of the position update produced by the discrete kinetic integrator, specifically the BAOAB scheme. It explicitly states the mathematical expression for the next position $x^+(\tau; x,v)$ based on the current state $(x, v)$ and time step $\tau$.

bullet_items.text:
The discrete kinetic integrator (BAOAB) produces position updates of the form:
$$x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)$$
bullet_items.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

parameters.description: Mass (implied denominator in the force term)

notes.text: The scheme referenced is BAOAB (a specific splitting integrator).

label: assumption-density-regularity-killing
title: Density Regularity
nl_summary: The phase-space density $f^\tau(x,v)$ at the start of a discrete timestep must be bounded in $L^\infty$ and possess spatial regularity, being continuously differentiable $C^1(\Omega)$ with a bounded gradient norm.

parameters.description: Phase-space density at the start of a discrete timestep
Positive constant bounding the $L^\infty$ norm of $f^\tau$
Bound for the $L^\infty$ norm of the spatial gradient of $f^\tau$
